bugtrap03.bugdomain

Class AbstractSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • bugtrap03.bugdomain.notificationdomain.Subject
      • bugtrap03.bugdomain.notificationdomain.AbstractSystemSubject
        • bugtrap03.bugdomain.AbstractSystem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProjectSubject, Subsystem

    @Invariant(value="this.constraintCheck() == True")
public abstract class AbstractSystem
extends AbstractSystemSubject
    This class represents an abstract system with a versionID, name, description and list of subsystem associated with this AbstractSystem.
    Author:
    Group 03.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSystem

        public AbstractSystem(AbstractSystem parent,
                      VersionID version,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String description,
                      Milestone milestone)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This constructor is used for all elements of type AbstractSystem, although possibly indirect.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent of this abstract system. (Can be null.)
        version - The versionID (of that type) of this element.
        name - The string name for this element.
        description - The string description of this element.
        milestone - The milestone of this element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the String arguments is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidVersionID(version) fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidMilestone(milestone) fails
        See Also:
        isValidVersionId(VersionID), isValidName(String), isValidDescription(String)

      • AbstractSystem

        public AbstractSystem(AbstractSystem parent,
                      VersionID version,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String description)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This constructor is used for all elements of type AbstractSystem, although possibly indirect.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent of this abstract system. (Can be null.)
        version - The versionID (of that type) of this element.
        name - The string name for this element.
        description - The string description of this element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the String arguments is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidVersionID(version) fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if isValidMilestone(milestone) fails
        See Also:
        isValidVersionId(VersionID), isValidName(String), isValidDescription(String)

        Throws:

      • setMilestone

        public void setMilestone(User user,
                         Milestone milestone)
                  throws PermissionException
        This method sets the Milestone of the project to the given Milestone. Children of this AbstractSystem will be recursively updated if required
        Parameters:
        user - The user that wants to change the milestone
        milestone - The new milestone
        Throws:
        PermissionException - If the given user doesn't have the needed permission
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When milestone is a invalid.
        See Also:
        isValidMilestone(Milestone)

      • isValidMilestone

        public boolean isValidMilestone(Milestone milestone)
        This method check if the given Milestone is a valid Milestone for an AbstractSystem Checks if the constraintCheck is still valid for the parent of this AbstractSystem
        Parameters:
        milestone - the Milestone to check
        Returns:
        true if the given Milestone is valid for an AbstractSystem.
        See Also:
        constraintCheck()

      • constraintCheck

        public boolean constraintCheck()
        This method checks the constraint for this AbstractSystem specified in the assignment:

        A project’s or subsystem’s achieved milestone should at all times be less than or equal to the highest achieved milestone of all the subsystems it (recursively) contains.

        Returns:
        if this state adheres to the constraint

      • setParent

        protected void setParent(AbstractSystem parent)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method sets the parent of this Abstract System to the given parent.
        Should be used with care as to maintain the bidirectional relation.
        Parameters:
        parent - The new parent of this Abstract System
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given parent was invalid
        See Also:
        isValidParent(AbstractSystem)

        Returns:
        True if the given Abstract System is valid as a parent

      • addSubsystem

        public Subsystem addSubsystem(VersionID version,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String description)
        This method adds a subsystem to this AbstractSystem
        The Milestone of the subsystem will be the lowest possible while adhering to the constraints.
        Parameters:
        version - The versionID of the new subsystem
        name - The name of the new subsystem
        description - The description of the new subsystem
        Returns:
        The new subsystems that was added to this AbstractSystem
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When name or description is invalid.

      • addSubsystem

        protected void addSubsystem(Subsystem subsystem)
        Add the given subsystem as a child.
        Should be used with care as to maintain bidirectional relation.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - The subsystem to add as a child of this.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When subsystem is already a subsystem in this project.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the parentProject does not match, implies you have to set the parent first.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When subsystem == null

      • addSubsystem

        @Ensures(value="result.getVersionID.equals(new VersionID())")
public Subsystem addSubsystem(java.lang.String name,
                                                                                             java.lang.String description)
        This method adds a subsystem to this AbstractSystem
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new subsystem
        description - The description of the new subsystem
        Returns:
        The new subsystems that was added to this AbstractSystem
        Throws:

      • setMemento

        public void setMemento(SubjectMemento mem)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the memento of this AbstractSystem.
        Overrides:
        setMemento in class AbstractSystemSubject
        Parameters:
        mem - The Memento to use to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When mem == null
